original_text: All the Israelites stood on each side of the Covenant Box, with their faces towards the priests who carried it. The leaders, officers, and judges were there, as well as foreign people who lived with the Israelites. Half the people stood with their backs to Mount Gerizim. The other half stood with their backs to Mount Ebal. Moses had told them to stand like that when the Lord wanted to bless them.
korean_text: 온 이스라엘과 그 장로들과 관리들과 재판장들과 본토인뿐 아니라 이방인까지 여호와의 언약궤를 멘 레위 사람 제사장들 앞에서 궤의 좌우에 서되 절반은 그리심 산 앞에, 절반은 에발 산 앞에 섰으니 이는 전에 여호와의 종 모세가 이스라엘 백성에게 축복하라고 명령한 대로 함이라

sentences.original_text: All the Israelites stood on each side of the Covenant Box
sentences.korean_translation: 모든 이스라엘 사람들은 언약궤 양쪽에 섰습니다

sentences.original_text: with their faces towards the priests who carried it
sentences.korean_translation: 그들의 얼굴은 그것을 운반하는 제사장들을 향했습니다

sentences.original_text: The leaders, officers, and judges were there
sentences.korean_translation: 지도자들, 관리들, 그리고 재판관들이 그곳에 있었습니다

sentences.original_text: as well as foreign people who lived with the Israelites
sentences.korean_translation: 이스라엘 사람들과 함께 살던 외국인들도 마찬가지였습니다

sentences.original_text: Half the people stood with their backs to Mount Gerizim
sentences.korean_translation: 백성의 절반은 등이 그리심 산을 향하게 하고 섰습니다

sentences.original_text: The other half stood with their backs to Mount Ebal
sentences.korean_translation: 나머지 절반은 등이 에발 산을 향하게 하고 섰습니다

sentences.original_text: Moses had told them to stand like that
when the Lord wanted to bless them
